messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, this is Letitia from the store Big Five on Green Valley. I have a person that is robbing me right now of my firearms. I need police to the store immediately.
Okay. Is he still in the store?
He is still in the store and he is getting my gun and he is breaking the lock with tools.
Is he white, black or Hispanic?
He is Hispanic.
About how old?
He gave me his ID. He actually came to purchase again. And he was born in 1989. So, he's 22.
What color shirt or jacket?
He's wearing a black shirt, black jeans. It has writing on his shirt. He's five foot seven, 150 pounds.
Where is he now?
He's in the firearms counter and he is sawing away at my firearms. He's sawing off the gun in his hand and he's sawing it off.
What do you mean by sawing off the gun?
He's got an electric saw blade. He is sawing my gun in half. He just grabbed the ammunition. He's actually loading the gun. Please send someone.
We've been on the way since we started talking. Where are you?
I am in my office looking right at him. Yeah, it's like that yellow writing on his shirt. It's like a rasta kind of looking shirt.
Are you open for business?
I am open for business. He is now walking towards outside the store. There is a customer in the front that doesn't even know what's going on.
Where is he now?
He is in the front of the store. He is walking towards the front. He is right at my doors. I think that he is waiting for some other people and he's going to get more.
Do you see anyone else with him?
No, he's by himself.
And did he load the gun?
He loaded the gun. He sawed it in half and loaded the gun. And he's walking back towards me. Oh my God, he just fired. Shots fired.
What's he shooting at?
I don't know. I just got underneath the desk.
Okay, that's okay. We're on our way, they should be there momentarily. Anyone hit, do you know?
Not that I know of. I know my cashier ducked down, she's scared.
They're outside, they're coming in.
Thank you. Where is he? Do you know?
It's okay, I'm staying on the phone with you. Do you hear anything?
I think he went back into the firearms counter. We have a buzzer so I can hear. He's trying to get into my office. Hold on. I'm going to tell them.
I have two employees out there that are unprotected, I'm so scared for them. Any other shots fired?
No, just one. Just one shot. And you heard the alarm go off?
No, the alarm has not gone off.
Oh my God, they're yelling. Two more shots. Two more shots. He's yelling 'get down'. He's firing again.
Okay, ma'am, the guy with the gun is down right now, okay? So you're okay at this moment. The officers are in there.
Okay, thank you so much.
Stay on the phone with me. Was there ever a second suspect or just that one man?
Just the one man. He came in for a transaction. I didn't notice anyone else.
The officers are going to come and knock on your door. Your office door. I'm staying on the phone with you until they knock.
Okay.
Are you okay?
Yes, it was just one man.
